translated: La première fois que je l'ai vu, on aurait dit qu'il était mort.

original: The husband and his wife drink tea.
translated: Le mari et la femme boivent du thé.

original: I need a snack.
translated: J'ai besoin d'une collation.

original: My French is actually not so good.
translated: Mon français n'est en réalité pas si bon.

original: I don't know my address yet, I'm going to stay with my friend for a while.
translated: Je ne connais pas encore mon adresse, je vais habiter un temps chez mon amie.

original: He was taken care of by a young doctor.
translated: C'est un jeune médecin qui s'est occupé de lui.

original: He painted a dog.
translated: Il peignit un chien.

original: Doesn't that car look familiar?
translated: Cette voiture ne semble-t-elle pas familière ?

original: The medicine didn't do me any good.
translated: Ce médicament ne m'a été d'aucun secours.

original: There was a lot of wind.
translated: Il y avait beaucoup de vent.

original: We all lie.
translated: Nous mentons tous.

original: I need to find somebody who can babysit on Friday nights.
translated: Il faut que je trouve quelqu'un pour garder les enfants vendredi soir.

original: I'm sorry, I don't recognize you.
translated: Je suis désolé, je ne te reconnais pas.

original: Where did you meet your boyfriend?
translated: Où as-tu rencontré ton mec ?

original: She spoke to me with a smile.
translated: Elle me parla avec un sourire.

original: Newton saw an apple fall off a tree.
translated: Newton a vu une pomme tomber d'un arbre.

original: I love horses.
translated: J'adore les chevaux.

original: "A chance of frost at night in low-lying areas," the weather forecast said.
translated: « Risque de gel nocturne sur les basses terres » disait-on au bulletin météo.

original: I was unable to go to his birthday party.
translated: Je me trouvai dans l'incapacité de me rendre à sa fête d'anniversaire.

original: The girl wore a yellow ribbon in her hair.
translated: La fille avait un ruban jaune dans les cheveux.

original: I didn't know that you owned a snake.
translated: J'ignorais que vous possédiez un serpent.

original: Get out!
translated: Casse-toi !

original: Send him in.
translated: Envoyez-le !

original: In the valley, the violets came out early.
translated: Dans la vallée les violettes sont apparues de bonne heure.

original: Who stole the apple?
translated: Qui a volé la pomme ?

original: I hate to travel.
translated: Je déteste voyager.

original: That is not a snake but a piece of rope.
translated: Ce n'est pas un serpent mais un bout de corde.

original: Life is a game of chess.
translated: La vie est un jeu d'échecs.

original: I'm lucky to have you as a friend.
translated: Je suis chanceux de t'avoir pour ami.

original: She abandoned herself to drinking.
translated: Elle s'abandonna à la boisson.

original: What do you say you join me for dinner?
translated: Que dis-tu de te joindre à moi pour dîner ?

original: If you eat too much, you'll become fat.
translated: Si tu manges trop, tu vas grossir.

original: Without a moment's hesitation, they took drastic action against the conspiracy.
translated: Sans un instant d'hésitation, ils prirent des mesures draconiennes contre la conspiration.

original: You knew I was married.
translated: Tu savais que j'étais marié.

original: Did you two have an argument?
translated: Vous vous êtes disputés ?

original: She asked for my assistance.
translated: Elle requit mon assistance.

original: Make me happy.
translated: Rends-moi heureux.

original: I've had a very long day.
translated: J'ai eu une très longue journée.

original: How long did it take you to write your book?
translated: Combien de temps as-tu mis à écrire ton livre ?

original: She's a very interesting person.
translated: Elle est une personne très intéressante.

original: We all want to know why you weren't here yesterday.
translated: Nous aimerions tous savoir pourquoi tu n'étais pas là hier.

original: I think they saw us.
translated: Je pense qu'ils nous ont aperçus.

original: They applauded.
translated: Ils ont applaudi.

original: Tom isn't a doctor.
translated: Tom n'est pas docteur.

original: This color is a bit darker than that one.
translated: Cette couleur est un peu plus sombre que celle-ci.

original: You look nice with your hair short.
translated: Les cheveux courts vous vont bien.

original: Ain't he cute?
translated: N'est-il pas mignon ?

original: Who left the lights on in the office?
translated: Qui a laissé les lumières du bureau allumées ?

original: The discussion will be over soon.
translated: La discussion sera bientôt terminée.

original: The gradient of a scalar-valued function of several variables is the vector which contains its partial derivatives with respect to each of its variables (when these derivatives exist).
translated: Le gradient d'une fonction scalaire de plusieurs variables est le vecteur qui contient ses dérivées partielles par rapport à chacune de ses variables (lorsque ces dérivées existent).

original: Seriously though, episode 21 made me almost cry while laughing.
translated: Mais sérieusement, l'épisode 21 m'a presque fait pleurer de rire.

original: You're stupid.
translated: Tu es idiote.

original: Would that the trees might wish to speak, instead of only making noise all the time.
translated: Si seulement les arbres voulaient parler au lieu de ne faire éternellement que bruire !

original: She likes books also.
translated: Elle aime les livres aussi.

original: Tom hasn't seen Mary yet.
translated: Tom n'a pas encore vu Mary.

original: You're mad!
translated: Tu délires !

original: I have a splinter in the palm of my hand.
translated: J'ai une écharde dans la paume de la main.

original: One should attack ideas with their own weapons: You do not shoot at ideas with a rifle.
translated: Il faut attaquer l'opinion avec ses armes : on ne tire pas des coups de fusil aux idées.

original: A number of passengers were injured in the accident.
translated: De nombreux passagers ont été blessés dans l'accident.

original: You are too critical of others' shortcomings.
translated: Tu es trop critique des défauts des autres.

original: Dig faster.
translated: Creuse plus vite.

original: I'm from Tokyo.
translated: Je viens de Tokyo.

original: Can you eat raw oysters?
translated: Peux-tu manger des huîtres crues ?

original: Are you sure of it?
translated: En êtes-vous sûre ?

original: What kind of places do you like?
translated: Quel genre d'endroits aimes-tu ?

original: Monica doesn't study a lot.
translated: Monica n'étudie pas beaucoup.

original: We went camping in August.
translated: Nous avons fait du camping au mois d'août.

original: Take a break.
translated: Fais une pause.

original: Come at ten o'clock sharp.
translated: Venez à vingt-deux heures précises.

original: How many kids do you have?
translated: Combien avez-vous d'enfants ?

original: The store was relatively empty.
translated: Le magasin était relativement vide.

original: Do you know where he bought his camera?
translated: Sais-tu où il a acheté son appareil photo ?

original: I have been writing this manuscript for a year.
translated: Cela fait un an que j'écris ce texte.

original: It's a misunderstanding.
translated: C'est une équivoque.

original: What kind of training have you had?
translated: Quelle sorte de formation as-tu reçue ?

original: Tom was third.
translated: Tom était troisième.

original: Tom said no one was arrested.
translated: Tom a dit que personne n'a été arrêté.

original: You can smoke in this room.
translated: Tu peux fumer dans cette pièce.

original: Wait a minute.
translated: Un instant...

original: Yanni survived.
translated: Yanni a survécu.

original: Money is a singular thing. It ranks with love as man's greatest source of joy. And with death as his greatest source of anxiety.
translated: L'argent est une chose particulière. Elle se classe avec l'amour comme la plus grande source de joie de l'homme et avec la mort comme sa plus grande source d'anxiété.

original: A daughter of the first Earl of Gowrie was courted by a young gentleman much her inferior in rank and fortune.
translated: Une fille du premier Earl de Gowrie était courtisée par un jeune gentilhomme bien inférieur à elle en rang et en fortune.

original: Do you use any illegal substances?
translated: Consommez-vous des substances illicites ?

original: She forgot to feed her dog.
translated: Elle oublia de nourrir son chien.

original: Tom wanted to be famous.
translated: Tom souhaitait être connu.

original: Her accent is perfect.
translated: Son accent est parfait.

original: Promise me that you won't sell your guitar to anyone but me.
translated: Promettez-moi que vous ne vendrez votre guitare à personne d'autre que moi.

original: I saw you with him.
translated: Je vous ai vues avec lui.

original: I can read.
translated: Je sais lire.

original: I'm a woman and I don't think that it's strange at all.
translated: Je suis une femme et je ne pense pas du tout que c'est étrange.

original: Those present at the meeting were surprised at the news.
translated: Ceux qui étaient présents à la réunion furent surpris par la nouvelle.

original: My father didn't know her.
translated: Mon père ne la connaissait pas.

original: When Tom spoke, they all remained silent.
translated: Quand Tom parla, ils restèrent tous silencieux.

original: I'm a member of the French Communist Party.
translated: Je suis membre du Parti communiste français.

original: I'm pretty sure Tom could do that.
translated: Je suis certain que Tom pourrait le faire.

original: It's not a secret anymore.
translated: Ce n'est plus un secret.

original: We're very happy.
translated: Nous sommes très heureux.

original: Are you sure it was Tom?
translated: Es-tu sûre que c'était Tom ?

original: It's hard to surprise him.
translated: Il est difficile de le surprendre.

original: He's addicted.
translated: Il est drogué.

original: It's possible that I'll go to your house with my new friend.
translated: Il est possible que je vienne chez toi avec ma nouvelle amie.

original: Don't you want to go?
translated: Ne veux-tu pas t'en aller ?

original: He resorted to his pint of wine for consolation, drank it all in a few minutes, and fell asleep on his arms, with his hair straggling over the table.
translated: Il avait recours à son demi de vin pour se consoler, le buvait en quelques minutes et s'endormait sur ses bras, les cheveux tombant sur la table.

original: I finally went to England this summer.
translated: Je suis finalement allé en Angleterre cet été.

original: Can I come to your office tomorrow?
translated: Puis-je venir à ton bureau demain ?

original: Waste disposal is a big problem in Algiers.
translated: Le traitement des déchets est un grand problème à Alger.

original: I got bored.
translated: J'ai commencé à m'ennuyer.

original: Is this really happening?
translated: Est-ce vraiment en train de se passer ?

original: I can't do that either.
translated: Je ne peux pas le faire non plus.

original: I hate school.
translated: Je déteste l'école.

original: I think my daughter's coming down with something.
translated: Je pense que ma fille souffre de quelque chose.

original: What's a UFO?
translated: Qu'est-ce que c'est qu'un OVNI ?

original: It's taboo.
translated: C’est un sujet tabou.

original: Tom knew that Mary couldn't swim, but he asked her to go swimming with him anyway.
translated: Tom savait que Mary ne pouvait pas nager, mais il lui a quand même demander d'aller nager avec lui.

original: On Saturday, Tom is having a party in his garden.
translated: Samedi, Tom donne une fête dans son jardin.

original: Can I call you Bob?
translated: Puis-je t'appeler Bob ?

original: When I got to school, the race had already finished.
translated: Lorsque je parvins à l'école, la course était déjà terminée.

original: We're still in good shape.
translated: Nous sommes toujours en forme.

original: The answer to both questions is no.
translated: La réponse aux deux questions est non.

original: We'd better hurry then.
translated: Alors nous ferions mieux de nous dépêcher.

original: Excuse me. What time is it?
translated: Pardon, quelle heure est-il ?

original: Sam, what are you doing?
translated: Sam, que fais-tu ?

original: I've been so busy this past week that I've hardly had time to relax.
translated: J'ai été tellement occupé la semaine dernière que j'ai à peine eu le temps de me détendre.

original: It was not conclusive.
translated: Ça n'a pas été concluant.

original: My brother is an idiot.
translated: Mon frère est un idiot.

original: How much did it cost you to get to Boston?
translated: Combien cela vous a-t-il coûté pour aller à Boston ?

original: Why all the drama?
translated: Pourquoi tout ce drame ?

original: I saw you yesterday.
translated: Je vous ai vue hier.

original: What's this?
translated: C'est quoi, ça ?

original: Tom took off.
translated: Tom a décollé.

original: No matter what I do, she says I can do better.
translated: Quoi que je fasse, elle dit que je peux mieux faire.

original: This is unbearable!
translated: C'est insupportable !

original: Have you ordered?
translated: As-tu commandé ?

original: Blow out the candles.
translated: Soufflez les bougies.

original: The doctor said that he would be well if he took his medicine.
translated: Le médecin a dit qu'il irait mieux s'il prenait son médicament.

original: He screamed.
translated: Il a crié.

original: Do black holes exist?
translated: Est-ce que les trous noirs existent ?

original: I am no match for him.
translated: Je ne suis pas de taille à me mesurer à lui.

original: It's a reflection of our society.
translated: C'est une réflection de notre société.

original: She told me that she loved me.
translated: Elle me dit qu'elle m'aimait.

original: I thought you'd like it.
translated: Je pensais que tu l'apprécierais.

original: I'm forced to agree with her.
translated: Je suis obligé d'être d'accord avec elle.

original: One of the magazines is for boys, and the other one is for girls.
translated: Un des magazines est pour les garçons et l'autre pour les filles.

original: Michael Jackson's album Thriller is the best-selling album of all time.
translated: L'album Thriller de Michael Jackson est l'album le plus vendu de tous les temps.

original: No one really knows what a UFO is like.
translated: Personne ne sait vraiment à quoi ressemble un OVNI.

original: I'm washing dishes.
translated: Je fais la vaisselle.

original: I'm not sure what's wrong. We should have heard from him by now.
translated: Je ne sais pas ce qui cloche, mais on aurait déjà dû avoir de ses nouvelles.

original: Newts are amphibians.
translated: Les tritons sont des amphibiens.

original: We pitched the tent next to the river.
translated: Nous avons planté la tente près de la rivière.

original: I don't know that word.
translated: J'ignore ce mot.

original: His breath reeks of booze.
translated: Son haleine empeste l'alcool.

original: I will speak with you tomorrow.
translated: Je parlerai avec toi demain.

original: He is a man of character.
translated: C’est un homme de caractère.

original: What I really want to do is sleep.
translated: Ce que je veux vraiment faire, c'est dormir.

original: I apologized immediately.
translated: J'ai présenté mes excuses sur-le-champ.

original: White was up the exchange (rook against bishop) with a passed pawn on a3. The win was a matter of technique.
translated: Les blancs avaient l'avantage de l'échange (tour contre fou) plus un pion passé en a3. La victoire était une question de technique.

original: Three of these are mine.
translated: Il y en a trois à moi.

original: She gets herself worked up over every little thing.
translated: Elle s'excite pour rien du tout.

original: We're all going home.
translated: Nous allons toutes chez nous.

original: Won't you come with me?
translated: Ne viendras-tu pas avec moi ?

original: I wouldn't care.
translated: Ça me serait égal.

original: I have tried for hours to remember where I put my keys, but it has completely escaped me.
translated: J'ai essayé pendant des heures de me rappeler où j'avais mis mes clefs, mais cela m'a complètement échappé.

original: I'm not going to explain it to you.
translated: Je ne vais pas te l'expliquer.

original: Do you have any money?
translated: As-tu un quelconque argent ?

original: He took credit for my idea.
translated: Il porta mon idée à son crédit.

original: That's all.
translated: C'est tout.

original: I can't believe I didn't even think of that.
translated: Je n'arrive pas à croire que je n'y ai même pas pensé.

original: Parliament passed the raft of spending cuts by a small majority.
translated: Le parlement a approuvé le plan d'économies par une courte majorité.

original: I can see his hand in this.
translated: Je reconnais là son œuvre.

original: I don't think I'd like you as a friend.
translated: Je ne pense pas que je vous apprécierais en tant qu'ami.

original: She always says no.
translated: Elle dit toujours non.

original: Replace the old tires with new ones.
translated: Échangez l'ancien train de pneus contre un neuf.

original: Do you have your own flat?
translated: Avez-vous votre propre appartement ?

original: This bag is too heavy.
translated: Ce sac est trop lourd.

original: There's no place like home.
translated: Rien ne vaut son chez-soi.

original: It's right.
translated: C'est vrai.

original: Those are your choices.
translated: Voilà les choix que tu as.

original: I'm not a good person.
translated: Je ne suis pas une bonne personne.

original: A major breakthrough in our understanding of the universe took place in the 1920's thanks to American astronomer Edwin Hubble.
translated: Une avancée majeure dans notre compréhension de l'univers a eu lieu dans les années 1920 grâce à l'astronome américain Edwin Hubble.

original: I can't distinguish a frog from a toad.
translated: Je ne peux pas distinguer une grenouille d'un crapaud.

original: Where is she now?
translated: Où est-elle, maintenant ?

original: Have you ever loved someone who never loved you back?
translated: Avez-vous jamais aimé quelqu'un qui ne vous aima jamais en retour ?

original: There is always heavy traffic here at this time of the day.
translated: Il y a toujours beaucoup de circulation ici à ce moment-ci de la journée.

original: Day breaks.
translated: Le jour se lève.

original: I'll admit I'm wrong.
translated: J'admettrai que j'ai tort.

original: The leaves fell to the ground.
translated: Les feuilles tombaient sur le sol.

original: The wind failed us.
translated: Le vent nous a manqué.

original: My life is like a test that I haven't studied for.
translated: Ma vie est comme un test pour lequel je n'ai pas étudié.

original: She sneaked up behind me.
translated: Elle s'est approchée de moi, par derrière, sans faire de bruit.

original: Be my right-hand man.
translated: Sois mon bras droit.

original: Do you know this woman's name?
translated: Connaissez-vous le nom de cette femme ?

original: Thanks for your quick answer.
translated: Merci de ta prompte réponse.

original: Where are they going to right now?
translated: Ils sont en train d'aller où ?

original: We will not fail.
translated: Nous n'échouerons pas.

original: Choose a current affairs issue.
translated: Choisis un problème d'actualité.

original: I can't fix everything by myself.
translated: Je ne peux pas tout corriger toute seule.

original: No one escaped.
translated: Personne ne s'est évadé.

original: I highly doubt that.
translated: J'en doute fortement.

original: He's the cutest boy in town.
translated: C'est le garçon le plus mignon en ville.

original: Could you read this for me?
translated: Pourriez-vous me lire cela ?

original: Are we sinking?
translated: Sommes-nous en train de couler ?

original: I will never forget her answer.
translated: Je n'oublierai jamais sa réponse.

original: The new Pope is not a woman and that's not a surprise.
translated: Le nouveau pape n'est pas une femme, et ce n'est pas une surprise.

original: The problem is that they only think about themselves.
translated: Le problème est qu'elles ne pensent qu'à elles.

original: I want to know now.
translated: Je veux le savoir maintenant.

original: They were worried about getting caught.
translated: Ils étaient inquiets de se faire prendre.

original: She couldn't take it any longer.
translated: Elle n'en pouvait plus.

original: Is it OK if I hug you?
translated: Puis-je vous enlacer ?

original: I want to work at a hospital.
translated: Je veux travailler dans un hôpital.

original: On a clear day, you can see Mt. Fuji.
translated: Par beau temps, on peut voir le Mt Fuji.

original: Tom studied French for three hours last night.
translated: Tom a étudié le français pendant trois heures la nuit dernière.

original: Do you like noodles with beef?
translated: Aimes-tu les nouilles au bœuf ?

original: I want you to push against my hand as hard as you can.
translated: Je veux que vous poussiez contre ma main aussi fort que vous le pouvez.

original: They'll get out of class in forty minutes.
translated: Ils vont sortir de classe dans quarante minutes.

original: I'll get in.
translated: J'arriverai à entrer.

original: And so God took mercy on her, and gave her a girl.
translated: Le bon Dieu eut donc pitié d’elle, et lui donna une petite fille.

original: I think you impressed them.
translated: Je pense que tu les as impressionnés.

original: They're out of sugar now.
translated: Ils sont à court de sucre maintenant.

original: He's capable of doing it.
translated: Il est capable de le faire.

original: I want to see your supervisor.
translated: Je veux voir votre chef.

original: I'm in the bathtub.
translated: Je suis dans la baignoire.

original: I ran across your mother in the library.
translated: Je suis tombé sur ta mère à la bibliothèque.

original: We brought him his son's completely bloodstained garment.
translated: On lui apporta le vêtement de son fils tout sanglant.

original: He did what he had been told.
translated: Il a fait ce qu'on lui avait dit.

original: They gave up.
translated: Elles abandonnèrent.

original: I had to go there yesterday.
translated: J'ai dû y aller hier.

original: Is it already open?
translated: Est-ce déjà ouvert ?

original: Don't talk to me!
translated: Ne me parle pas !

original: This fish is big.
translated: Ce poisson est gros.

original: Idir is my favorite Berber singer.
translated: Idir est mon chanteur berbère préféré.

original: An impostor wants to be believed on his word; he wants to make authority by himself.
translated: Un imposteur veut être cru sur parole, il veut lui-même faire autorité.

original: She seems to be involved in that murder case.
translated: Elle semble être impliquée dans cette affaire de meurtre.

original: She leaned on his shoulder.
translated: Elle se pencha sur son épaule.

original: I'm sure you'll succeed.
translated: Je suis certaine que tu réussiras.

original: Is there a theater in your town?
translated: Y a-t-il un théâtre dans votre ville ?

original: Tom expected it to cost a lot more.
translated: Tom s'attendait à ce que cela coûte beaucoup plus cher.

original: They don't even know why.
translated: Ils ne savent même pas pourquoi.

original: She talked.
translated: Elle parlait.

original: What did Tom steal?
translated: Qu'est-ce que Tom a volé ?

original: Almost no one believed her.
translated: Presque personne ne la croyait.

original: I'm at a truck stop.
translated: Je suis dans un relais routier.

original: He kissed her again.
translated: Il l'embrassa à nouveau.

original: For what reason did you cry?
translated: Pour quelle raison as-tu pleuré ?

original: Are there any loose cables?
translated: Est-ce qu'il y a des câbles lâches ?

original: We saw a boy run over by a truck.
translated: Nous avons vu un garçon écrasé par un camion.

original: She is appearing on TV tonight.
translated: Elle passe à la télé ce soir.

original: I see a woman.
translated: Je vois une femme.

original: Yesterday, I bought a red car.
translated: Hier, j'ai acheté une voiture rouge.

original: Tom dropped by Mary's house just to say hello.
translated: Tom est passé chez Marie juste pour dire bonjour.

original: This is a pen.
translated: C'est un stylo.

original: When was your last tetanus booster?
translated: À quand remonte votre dernier rappel de tétanos ?

original: I bought some of this cheese.
translated: J'ai acheté un peu de ce fromage-ci.

original: Jim is liked by all his classmates.
translated: Jim est apprécié de tous ses copains de classe.

original: Are you frightened?
translated: Es-tu effrayé ?

original: Why do I believe you?
translated: Pourquoi est-ce que je vous crois ?

original: Nothing could please us more.
translated: Rien ne pourrait plus nous faire plaisir.

original: What's your favorite radio station?
translated: Quelle est votre station de radio préférée ?

original: I suggest you tell me the truth.
translated: Je te suggère de me dire la vérité.

original: They are much taller than us.
translated: Ils sont beaucoup plus grands que nous.

original: He is walking now.
translated: Il est actuellement en train de marcher.

original: How many Christmas carols can you sing by heart?
translated: Combien de chants de Noël sais-tu chanter par cœur ?

original: Are you happy?
translated: Es-tu contente ?

original: I like fruit.
translated: J'aime les fruits.

original: You're very timid.
translated: Vous êtes très peureuses.

original: They're not mine.
translated: Ce ne sont pas les miens.

original: She picked up her toys.
translated: Elle ramassa ses jouets.

original: You'll have to wait at least an hour to get a ticket.
translated: Vous devrez attendre au moins une heure pour obtenir un billet.

original: He drank the beer in one gulp.
translated: Il avala la bière en une seule gorgée.

original: The alarm will probably already have gone off.
translated: L'alarme se sera probablement déjà déclenchée.

original: The only thing he cares about is himself.
translated: La seule chose dont il se préoccupe, c'est lui-même.

original: She was advised by him not to go.
translated: Il lui a conseillé de ne pas partir.

original: Our dog has gone away.
translated: Notre chien est parti.

original: They don't make them like they used to.
translated: Elles ne les font plus ainsi qu'elles les faisaient.

original: The Kabyles would like to see the Ukrainians and the Russians live side by side in peace.
translated: Les Kabyles voudraient voir les ukrainiens et les russes vivre en paix cote à cote.

original: I am looking for a job with the Ministry of Culture of France.
translated: Je cherche un poste au ministère français de la Culture.

original: Where do you think Tom is?

original: She's dependent on her husband.

original: That doesn't suit me because I have to leave at 5 P.M.

original: Please leave this room.

original: He scooped up sand by the handful.

original: The amoeba is a unicellular organism.
translated: L'amibe est un organisme unicellulaire.

original: Kids are smarter than you think.

original: When he has eaten, he goes to sleep.
translated: Lorsqu'il a mangé, il va dormir.

original: How can anyone sleep with all this commotion going on?

original: Nothing new.

original: Add one teaspoon of paprika.

original: That was very interesting.

original: I want some money.

original: You didn't say that before.

original: He accepted our offer.

original: There is another question too that we must discuss.

original: No one is more fortunate than the one who believes in his luck.
translated: Nul n'est plus chanceux que celui qui croit à sa chance.

original: At what time do you go to bed?

original: Tom moved to Boston in 2013.

original: Some of these apples are bad.

original: I love the Marseille metro.

original: You're fussy.

original: She threw herself into my arms.

original: The concert was successful.

original: There are many apple trees in the garden.

original: I will be back in an hour.

original: She is listening to him.

translated: Elle est arrivée chez elle à sept heures.

original: Does anyone have a mobile phone charger?

original: I think I'd like to be your friend.

original: Why are you with me?

original: Can I borrow this for a while?

original: I heard everything clearly.

original: I kicked him out.

original: I take back what I said.

original: I'm a bit tipsy.

original: What an idiot you are!

original: Tom doesn't think it'll rain, but he plans to carry an umbrella just in case.
translated: Tom ne pense pas qu'il va pleuvoir, mais il a l'intention de prendre un parapluie au cas où.

original: Where can I leave my bicycle?

original: Yesterday I got tired out and I need to rest.
translated: Hier je me suis fatigué et j'ai besoin de me reposer.

original: I fight in the cause of justice.

original: Tom told Mary about his imaginary friend.

original: Nothing's forcing you to stay.

original: Do you go by train or by car?

original: I wasn't able to come because of the rain.

original: Please turn off your engine.

original: Our friends were evacuated from their farm because of the bushfires in their area.

original: We must put aside the idea of a single time; only multiple times, those of experience, count.
translated: On doit mettre de côte l’idée d’un temps unique ; seuls comptent les temps multiples, ceux de l’expérience.

original: I do remember the incident quite well.
translated: Je me souviens très bien de l'incident.

original: I just moved in yesterday.

original: I only slept two hours.

original: She felt happy to see him.

translated: Il est où ton billet de vingt ? J'te l'échange contre un de cinq.

original: A motel is like a hotel only much smaller and is used mostly by people traveling by automobile.
translated: Un motel ressemble à un hôtel, mais c'est plus petit et utilisé principalement par des gens qui voyagent en voiture.

original: Tom taught Mary to read.
translated: Tom a appris à lire à Marie.

original: People always make fun of me when they find out I'm colorblind.

original: How pretty is this flower!

original: I can't believe you let this happen.

original: She turned on the TV.

original: She mistook the sugar for salt.

original: The dog looks sick.

original: Why didn't you tell this to the police?

original: Overcome weakness.

original: I didn't expect you to get here so soon.

original: Maybe I should go with you.

original: I only asked if I could borrow the book.

original: Everyone feels a little grossed out at the thought of their parents having sex.
translated: Tout le monde se sent un peu outré à l'idée de ses parents entretenant des relations sexuelles.

original: Whose shoes are these?
translated: À qui sont ces chaussures ?

original: She was wearing a mink coat.

original: Don't forget your costume.

original: Tom thought it would be a good idea to leave early.
translated: Tom a pensé que ce serait une bonne idée de partir tôt.

original: This was not supposed to happen.

original: His plan was discarded.

original: Water is indispensable to plants.

original: I have a lot of friends that can speak Portuguese well.

original: I misunderstood.

original: We were attacked by bandits.
translated: Nous avons été attaqués par des bandits.

original: In all probability, the cabinet will fall.
translated: Selon toute probabilité, le gouvernement va tomber.

original: We went to the theater early, so we could be sure that everyone could get a seat.
translated: Nous nous rendîmes tôt au théâtre, de sorte que nous puissions être assurés que chacun pourrait avoir un fauteuil.

original: I'd like to rent a car, please.

original: High calorie foods are bad for my health.
translated: Les nourritures à niveau élevé en calories sont mauvaises pour ma santé.

original: Wait just a second.

original: I'm learning Russian.
translated: J'apprends le russe.

original: You are very brave.
translated: Vous êtes très courageuse.

original: She decided to have surgery.
translated: Elle se décida à recourir à la chirurgie.

original: Because I speak Chinese.
translated: Parce que je parle chinois.

original: I'll go first.
translated: Je vais y aller en premier.

original: I don't know why you didn't tell the truth.

original: Tom is completely incompetent.

original: What will you do on Christmas Day?

original: I don't know who you want to see.

original: What is his shoe size?

original: I have to be up early tomorrow morning, so I'm going to bed.

original: My headache stopped.

original: I think we've wasted enough of your time.

original: Tom threw a stone into the pond.
translated: Tom a lancé une pierre dans l'étang.

original: Don't be so sharp with the children.

original: Tom came into my office and closed the door.
translated: Tom est venu dans mon bureau et a fermé la porte.

original: Pedro Álvares Cabral is considered to be the one who discovered Brazil.
translated: Pedro Álvares Cabral est considéré comme celui qui a découvert le Brésil.

original: Let's handle this one problem at a time.

original: Would you buy that?

original: They won't last that long.

original: Do you speak Chinese?

original: I took care of my sick sister.

original: Will you be spending Christmas with Tom?

original: Mary is a fast swimmer, isn't she?

original: What did you drink?

original: She had already gone to bed when I called her at 11 p.m.
translated: Elle était déjà allée se coucher quand je lui ai téléphoné à 23 h.

original: I just want to talk to them.

original: I understand your French.

original: I prefer living in the country to living in the city.

original: My dream has come true.

original: I am exhausted.

original: It's time to get serious.

original: She makes a living from writing.

original: In a manner of speaking, yes.

original: I was glad to hear the news.

original: Inform me of the details.

original: John felt the presence of a ghost in the dark room.

original: She's demented.

original: I gave him much trouble.

original: He doesn't love us.

original: I still don't get it.

original: Where's my razor?

original: You will read it another day.

original: He is old enough to travel alone.

original: Let's not beat around the bush.

original: If peace cannot be maintained with honor, it is no longer peace.

original: The sea is to fish what the sky is to birds.

translated: Les faux amis sont des paires de mots dans deux langues qui sont similaires en orthographe ou en prononciation mais dont les significations sont différentes.

original: Do you use bath salts?
translated: Prends-tu de la benzylpipérazine ?

original: I love everything about Tom.
translated: J'aime tout de Tom.

original: That's good for a first try.

original: I go to my father's place twice a year.
translated: Je vais chez mon père deux fois par an.

original: Give me a counterexample.

original: Do you have a husband?

original: I feel ashamed that I got such bad marks in the examination.
translated: Je suis honteux d'avoir reçu de si mauvaises notes a l'examen.

original: Tom saw nothing.
translated: Tom n'a rien vu.

original: He blew the deal.
translated: Il a sabordé le contrat.

translated: Qui est plus utile, le soleil ou la lune ? La lune, bien entendu, elle brille quand il fait noir, alors que le soleil brille uniquement quand il fait clair.

original: It's too hot! The snowman is going to disappear soon!
translated: Il fait trop chaud ! Le bonhomme de neige va bientôt disparaître !

original: Our fridge is broken.

original: Here is your dog!

original: He's in Tokyo.

original: Congratulations!

original: She misses him, especially on rainy days.
translated: Il lui manque, particulièrement les jours de pluie.

original: Tom looks astonished.
translated: Tom a l'air stupéfait.

original: As the Holy Koran tells us, "Be conscious of God and speak always the truth."
translated: Comme le Coran sacré nous l'enseigne, « Soyez conscient de Dieu et dites toujours la vérité. »

original: Oh my God! Someone is knocking at the door!
translated: Ciel ! On frappe à la porte !

original: I saw a mouse scamper across the floor.
translated: J'ai vu une souris détaler sur le sol.

original: I'm impressed with your French.

original: I prefer travelling by train to flying.
translated: Je préfère voyager en train que de voler.

original: I'm glad you brought that up.

original: Don't deceive me.

original: She was not seriously injured.
translated: Elle n'était pas sérieusement blessée.

original: She thought that I was the doctor.
translated: Elle pensa que j'étais le médecin.

original: Don't you have any good news?
translated: N'avez-vous pas la moindre bonne nouvelle ?

original: Father is angry with me.
translated: Père est en colère contre moi.

original: His knowledge of Chinese enabled us to carry out our plan smoothly.
translated: Sa connaissance du chinois nous permit de dérouler notre plan aisément.

original: She hurried across the lawn.
translated: Elle se précipita à travers la pelouse.

original: During the Stalinist era, prisoners at concentration camps became slaves in service of the state.
translated: Pendant l'époque stalinienne, les prisonniers des camps de concentration devenaient esclaves au service de l'État.

original: Some of them were wounded.
translated: Certains d'entre eux ont été blessés.

original: This food smells rotten.
translated: Cette nourriture a une odeur de pourri.

original: I'm really going to miss this place.
translated: Cet endroit va vraiment me manquer.

original: I'm reading a novel by Sidney Sheldon.
translated: Je suis en train de lire un roman de Sidney Sheldon.

original: That would be fantastic.
translated: Ce serait fantastique.

original: You must be crazy.
translated: Tu dois être fou.

original: We're bored.
translated: Nous nous ennuyons.

original: You have no idea.
translated: Vous n'en avez aucune idée.

original: I'm a native French speaker.
translated: Je suis de langue maternelle française.

original: I avoid going there late at night.
translated: J'évite de m'y rendre tard le soir.

original: The day after Christmas it snowed.
translated: Le lendemain de Noël il a neigé.

original: Look at the blackboard.
translated: Regardez le tableau.

original: Do you study every day?
translated: Étudies-tu chaque jour ?

original: The surprise party for Laura is not tonight, but tomorrow night.
translated: La fête surprise pour Laura n'est pas ce soir, mais demain soir.

original: Come over.
translated: Viens chez moi !

original: The problem with many things is the pre-conceived ideas we have about them!
translated: Le problème avec beaucoup de choses sont les idées préconçues que nous avons à leur sujet !

original: She pooh-poohed the idea with a disdainful wave of her hand.
translated: Elle rejeta l'idée d'un mouvement de main dédaigneux.

original: I like winter.
translated: J'aime l'hiver.

original: She came running up.
translated: Elle est arrivée en courant.

original: May I visit you tomorrow?
translated: Je peux te rendre visite demain ?

original: These plants are all poisonous.
translated: Ces plantes sont toutes toxiques.

original: They want to return.
translated: Ils veulent revenir.

original: The French flag is blue, white, and red.
translated: Le drapeau français est bleu, blanc, et rouge.

original: She was dressed in red.
translated: Elle était vêtue de rouge.

original: I get along with everyone.
translated: Je m'entends bien avec tout le monde.

original: Dry the pants on the radiator.
translated: Sèche le pantalon sur le radiateur !

original: I understand exactly what Tom is going through.
translated: Je comprends tout à fait ce que Tom est en train de vivre.

original: It's French.
translated: C'est français.

original: I wonder who named this ship.
translated: Je me demande qui a nommé ce bateau.

original: We've had a lot of complaints about how you treat your classmates.
translated: Nous avons eu de nombreuses plaintes au sujet de la manière dont tu traites tes camarades de classe.

original: Do you like it?
translated: Est-ce que tu l'aimes ?

original: Can you keep an eye on him?
translated: Tu peux garder un œil sur lui ?

original: This urchin was so nimble, that it was utterly impossible to lay hold of him.
translated: Ce garnement était si preste qu'il était tout à fait impossible de lui mettre la main dessus.

original: People like a happy ending.
translated: Les gens aiment une fin heureuse.

original: Tell me which you want.
translated: Dis-moi lequel tu veux.

original: I want to go back to where we were.

original: In what year were you born?

original: Europeans never colonized Ethiopia, but not for lack of trying.
translated: Les Européens n'ont jamais colonisé l'Éthiopie, mais ce n'est pas faute d'essayer.

original: Is this seat vacant?
translated: Cette place est-elle libre ?

original: My child likes to sleep between me and my wife.
translated: Mon enfant aime dormir entre moi et mon épouse.

original: More can often be gleaned from body language than from what is actually being said.
translated: On peut souvent apprendre davantage du langage corporel que de ce qui est effectivement dit.

original: What crazy!

original: You did not answer my question.
translated: Vous ne répondîtes pas à ma question.

original: You will soon come to like this town.
translated: Vous viendrez bientôt à aimer cette ville.

original: His health is improving little by little.
translated: Sa santé s'améliore petit à petit.

original: He left for New York a week ago.
translated: Il est parti pour New York il y a une semaine.

original: Don't leave your work unfinished.
translated: Ne laissez pas votre travail inachevé.

original: I told you to sign the document.
translated: Je vous ai dit de signer le document.

original: The documents should be sent to Paris well in advance.
translated: Les documents devraient être envoyés longtemps à l'avance.

original: I enjoyed talking to her.
translated: J'eus plaisir à m'entretenir avec elle.

original: I'll be six feet under by then.
translated: Je serai à deux mètres sous terre d'ici là.

original: They said they would do that for us.
translated: Elles ont déclaré qu’elles le feraient pour nous.

original: I'm just trying to be a good father.
translated: J'essaye simplement d'être un bon père.

original: Are you leaving today?
translated: Vous en allez-vous aujourd'hui ?

original: Tom's stranded.
translated: Tom est en difficulté.

original: I still need to talk to you.
translated: Il me faut encore vous parler.

original: We must be able to differentiate between objects and situations.
translated: Nous devons être capables de différencier entre les objets et les situations.

original: I'm interfering.
translated: Je me mêle de ce qui ne me regarde pas.

original: In comparison with yours, my car is small.
translated: À titre de comparaison avec la vôtre, ma voiture est petite.

original: The church is on the other side of the street.
translated: L’église est de l’autre côté de la rue.

original: At the time, music was everything to us.
translated: À cette époque, la musique était tout, pour nous.

original: It's been five years since we moved here.
translated: Cela fait cinq ans que nous avons emménagé ici.

original: You're smart.
translated: Tu es intelligent.

original: Amnesty International often organizes public protests in support of political prisoners.
translated: Amnistie internationale organise souvent des manifestations en soutien aux prisonniers politiques.

original: They were approaching.
translated: Elles approchaient.

original: A girl stood there crying.
translated: Là se tenait une fille en pleurs.

original: Sure, gladly.
translated: Bien sûr, avec plaisir.

original: Start reading where you left off.
translated: Commencez à lire là où vous vous êtes arrêtées.

original: Tom admitted that he'd killed Mary.
translated: Tom avoua qu'il avait tué Mary.

original: In order to find a proper solution, we need to know which constraints we face.
translated: Afin de trouver une solution adéquate, nous devons savoir à quelles contraintes nous sommes confrontés.

original: This flower is yellow and the others are blue.
translated: Cette fleur est jaune et les autres sont bleues.

original: What's a beautiful woman like you doing in a place like this?
translated: Qu'est-ce qu'une belle femme comme vous fait dans un endroit pareil ?

original: I really liked the gift you gave me.
translated: J'ai beaucoup aimé le cadeau que vous m'avez fait.

original: Do you think he did the job on his own?
translated: Penses-tu qu'il ait fait ce travail tout seul ?

original: I feel so helpless.
translated: Je me sens tellement impuissant.

original: Snow falls on the mountains.
translated: La neige tombe sur les montagnes.

original: They always drink their coffee strong.
translated: Ils boivent toujours leur café corsé.

original: I didn't really want to do that.
translated: Je ne voulais pas vraiment faire cela.

original: Tom sent Mary a selfie.
translated: Tom a envoyé un selfie à Marie.

original: Well!
translated: Bien !

original: A moat surrounds the castle.
translated: Des douves entourent le château.

original: What evidence do you have?
translated: De quelles preuves disposez-vous ?

original: We know that all men are mortal.
translated: Nous savons que tous les hommes sont mortels.

original: I didn't mean to confuse him.
translated: Je ne voulais pas l'embrouiller.

original: He has a good chance of getting elected.
translated: Il a de bonnes chances d'être élu.

original: You have no sense of direction.
translated: Tu n'as aucun sens de l'orientation.

original: Where did you put the television guide?
translated: Où as-tu mis le programme de télévision ?

original: Is it that obvious?
translated: Est-ce si évident ?

original: I sing now.
translated: Je chante maintenant.

original: The baby is adorable.
translated: Le bébé est mignon.

original: You're direct.
translated: Tu es direct.

original: Monday definitely isn't my favourite day of the week.
translated: Le lundi n'est certainement pas mon jour de la semaine préféré.

original: Talk to you later.
translated: À plus tard !

original: Do as you like.
translated: Faites comme vous voulez.

original: She refused my invitation.
translated: Elle refusa mon invitation.

original: Life never ends but earthly life does.
translated: La vie ne s'arrête jamais, mais la vie terrestre, oui.

original: I don't have a wife.
translated: Je n'ai pas de femme.

original: I think Tom can help.
translated: Je pense que Tom peut m'aider.

original: Tom taught Mary how to ride a bicycle.
translated: Tom a appris à Marie à faire du vélo.

original: I finally have time to reply to the mail that I have received these past three weeks.
translated: Je dispose enfin du temps pour répondre à la correspondance que j'ai reçue ces trois dernières semaines.

original: The Mona Lisa has an enigmatic smile.
translated: La Joconde arbore un sourire énigmatique.

original: I thought about you the other day.
translated: J'ai pensé à vous l'autre jour.

original: If I had eaten breakfast this morning, I would not be hungry now.
translated: Si j'avais pris mon petit déjeuner ce matin, je n'aurais pas faim maintenant.

original: As it was printed in haste, the book has many misprints.
translated: Comme il avait été publié à la hâte, le livre avait de nombreuses coquilles.

original: Beware!
translated: Fais attention !

original: Why are you waiting in line?
translated: Pourquoi faites-vous la queue ?

original: Tom said he was alone.
translated: Tom a dit qu'il était seul.

original: I haven't been sleeping well lately.
translated: Je ne dors pas bien ces derniers temps.

original: Oy, why do you hit me?!
translated: Eh, pourquoi m'as-tu frappé ?!

original: Do you know where my keys are?
translated: Sais-tu où se trouvent mes clés ?

original: Get your hair cut!
translated: Faites-vous couper les cheveux !

original: It's a very serious crime.
translated: C'est un crime très grave.

original: You should have told me about the problem sooner.
translated: Vous auriez dû me parler du problème plus tôt.

original: We have to make sure we get there on time.
translated: Nous devons nous assurer d'arriver à temps.
